alignments.description: Completers of this program demostrate these key competencies: Leading People, Managing Work, Developing Self, Systemic Integration, Personal & Organizational Integrity, Public Service Focus, and Change Leadership.

badge_template_activities.title: The CPI 260 ® instrument was designed specifically assessing management and leadership potential. This instrument contains 260 items carefully selected from the original California Psychological Inventory assessment to identify an individual’s strengths and areas for development. The CPI 260 instrument is used extensively within organizations for a variety of leadership and development applications as well as high-potential identification.

The CPM program finalizes studies with a capstone project.  Participants use curriculum from the program and other studies, to develop a project around their local agency to increase efficiency or save money.  The project is worth 75 hours towards the certification, and consists of a 5-20 page paper.

Participants complete several courses including, Emotional Intelligence, Motivation & Deligation, Ethics & Primary Greatness, HR Management, Process Improvement, Negotiation and Conflict Resolution, CHange Leadership, Crisis Management, and Leadership in Public Organizations.
Participants present their capstone project at the end of the program to showcase their project to the assessment panel and current class.

1f67ff51-1ba7-4a30-b2d7-af455b0d90b6.description: LEIC’s Master Public Information Office Certification is a 40-hour, Peace Officer Standards and Training Commission (POST)-approved course for law enforcement personnel who serve as public information officers (PIO) or command staff who, in the event of an incident, address the public through media platforms. PIO-s interact with the public through press releases, media releases, or media and press conferences. They also work to positively represent their agency through social media platforms.

badge_template_activities.title: UT LEIC is proud to lead the nation with our innovative programs for law enforcement professionals. The Master Public Information Officer Certification from The University of Tennessee System, through the Law Enforcement Innovation Center, is the first university-based program of its kind. Through pre-work, instruction, networking, and a group project, participants discuss writing, agency branding, social media, emotional intelligence, and how to communicate to the public through a crisis.
Participants complete pre-work, 40 hours of instruction, and homework.
Course participants complete a project capstone and must earn a passing score of 85/100 points to earn certification. Capstone projects are graded using a course rubric.
